meanings.definition: To perform a ceremony or ritual with seriousness and reverence.
meanings.sent1: The couple will solemnize their marriage vows in a beautiful church ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The judge will solemnize the signing of the legal documents.
meanings.sent3: The pets solemnize their daily mealtime with a cute little dance.
meanings.sent4: The sun solemnizes the end of the day with a colorful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The teacher solemnizes the start of the school year with an inspiring speech.

meanings.definition: To make something official or legally binding.
meanings.sent1: The notary will solemnize the contract by stamping it with an official seal.
meanings.sent2: The government will solemnize the new law by publishing it in the official gazette.
meanings.sent3: The siblings solemnize their agreement to share the toy by shaking hands.
meanings.sent4: The handshake solemnizes their commitment to honesty and trust.
meanings.sent5: The signature solemnizes the completion of the important document.

meanings.definition: To celebrate or observe with formal ceremony.
meanings.sent1: The school will solemnize its anniversary with a grand ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The community will solemnize the national holiday with a parade.
meanings.sent3: The family solemnizes the annual reunion with a big feast.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks solemnize the joy of the festive occasion.
meanings.sent5: The choir solemnizes the event with a beautiful performance.
